item.title: Leanna add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "The mind is not a book, to be opened at will and examined at leisure. Thoughts are not etched on the inside of skulls, to be perused by an invader. The mind is a complex and many-layered thing." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Leanna add a quote by John Scalzi
item.description: "Here's a quick rule of thumb: Don't annoy science fiction writers. These are people who destroy entire planets before lunch. Think of what they'll do to you." -- John Scalzi

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "I assure you; while I look like a ghost, I'm no spirit or demon. I'm nothing but a girl struggling to make her way in an intolerant world. I bleed, I love, and someday, I'll die." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "One spirit remained unaware of his presence, staring at Miss Parker with such longing that he reluctantly decided to let it stay. The spirit, a hollow-eyed girl with ringlets and clothing from long past, reached toward Percy, wishing to touch her. Alexi understood. When left to her own devices, Miss Parker was neither shy nor awkward; she was radiant." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "The Goddess spoke to all the dead. She was beloved for it. It seemed she passed on that gift to you. Oh, it taxed her immensely, but she tried to set as many to rest as she could. Sometimes it only takes one word of kindness, you know, to set a soul at ease." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "He's Darkness. Unpleasant. I wouldn't trust him. Nor do I trust every mortal I meet. I don't know where evil comes from, and frankly it doesn't matter. Not right now. Histories and myths are renamed and reinvented eternally across the world. I can't speak to that. What I do know? This is your story." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "Persephone is just a name for a spirit of beauty at a certain time in history. I'm sure we could argue a biblical place for her if it matters. Your wife has the name of that pagan goddess, but the fact remains that she's your mortal bride in the Year of Our Lord 1888- and she's Catholic, so pray for her, damn it, I don't care how confusing it is. And pray for us, to anyone. If the dead are about to flood Athens, divine goodwill couldn't hurt. Your prayers can be in Hindu, if you like. Now go home." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description:
"When the Guard convinced you fate was not on our side, you parted ways with me and saw fit to make me suffer,' Percy stated. The pain on Alexi's face worsened, and he opened his mouth to refute her. She put her hands lovingly on his cheeks. 'We survived. Our love survived. And we shall again.'
He stared at her in wonder. 'How did my dear girl grow so brave?'
Percy grinned. 'Didn't you hear? The meek shall inherit the earth." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Those who find ugly meanings in beautiful things are corrupt without being charming. This is a fault. Those who find beautiful meanings in beautiful things are the cultivated. For these there is hope. They are the elect to whom beautiful things mean only Beauty. There is no such thing as a moral or an immoral book. Books are well written, or badly written. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description:
"Ibrahim shook his head. "Women. You are enigmas."
"No, we're just always waiting for men to say the proper thing. Now and then you do. And upon such occasion, we rejoice." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "Lives should never be down to mere words, but I suppose they always are. Whether declarations of war, law, or treaty... words ever determine lives." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "Coffee first. Schemes later." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "What good was speaking when I'd determined none of the world listened to one another, especially not when a woman was speaking." -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "You are lucky to be one of those people who wishes to build sand castles with words, who is willing to create a place where your imagination can wander. We build this place with the sand of memories; these castles are our memories and inventiveness made tangible. So part of us believes that when the tide starts coming in, we won't really have lost anything, because actually only a symbol of it was there in the sand. Another part of us thinks we'll figure out a way to divert the ocean. This is what separates artists from ordinary people: the belief, deep in our hearts, that if we build our castles well enough, somehow the ocean won't wash them away. I think this is a wonderful kind of person to be." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "For some of us, books are as important as almost anything else on earth. What a miracle it is that out of these small, flat, rigid squares of paper unfolds world after world after world, worlds that sing to you, comfort and quiet or excite you. Books help us understand who we are and how we are to behave. They show us what community and friendship mean; they show us how to live and die." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "Great things may not change the world, but they will change the people around you" -- Leanna Renee Hieber

item.title: Leanna add a quote by Leanna Renee Hieber
item.description: "God brings people into our lives precisely when we need them." -- Leanna Renee Hieber
